reviews.text: Stayed at Marriott South Beach for a little relaxation before going on a cruise. This hotel was a perfect location. Far enough away from the craziness of South Beach, but close enough to walk to it. The room was clean and a good size. The pool was not overly crowded and neither was the beach. From the moment we walked in hotel made us feel welcome. Plan on staying again next year when we go cruising again.
reviews.title: Great hotel before Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had very high expectation before driving to this hotel. The check in was very pleasant, also the valet parking was friendly. We paid for an upgrade to an ocean front room also based on the reviews here. The view was great. However there was a very loud noise coming from the restaurant/bar below. This noise is from 6AM-12PM!! In the evening almost everything closed. Including the Starbucks however you guessed it, the music from the restaurant continued!!!
reviews.title: Stay away from this hotel

reviews.text: There are almost no dining options in the neighborhood. It’s in a very quite part of south beach. When walking around in the evening most of the restaurants where closed, we ended up in the hotel. The food there is good. However expected more from south beach location
reviews.title: beach made it worth it

reviews.text: The pool is very small and very crowded. There are not enough chairs and people reserve chairs in the morning and leave. Also the pool is not very deep.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: The location is the key here, overpriced for the hotel itself but all I kept hearing was "hey this is south beach" thank god for the pool and the beach. Room was just ok. For what it cost to stay and park I expected more.
reviews.title: Quiet Location, Great for BUSINESS TRAVELERS. Not for vacationers!

reviews.text: Our first trip with the children to the US. We had a great stay in the Marriott, an awesome oceanfront room, thnx mr.B.! and very helpfull friendly staff overall.Great beach and pool area.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were two big parties staying at the hotel, but we did not heard any noice at all!!!
reviews.title: A...... Needs a bit of polish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definitely come back in this hotel before we return home!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Surprised my wife for a 4 day with Marriott points. The hotel is located on a great part of the beach though walking from where the restaurants and bars were at 3 Am between 5th street to 1 street does not seem to be the safest. I thought the Ocean Drive restaurant theme carried all the way down to the Marriott. It Does not. I grew up in NY so I am comfortable with areas but ladies in my opinion keep an eye out. The hotel was nice but 35,000 point per night questionable. One a South Beach not I was surprised that everywhere you eat and drink they include gratuity. So at the Marriott a beer and virgin pina colada with tax and tip $24. The one thing I found disappointing was the outside lounge area where the fire pit tables were is disgusting IE very dirty ( left over glasses, butts on the ground ). The lounge chairs and cushions are FILTHY - Did I say Filthy. Not what I have experienced at my many other Marriott trips. . Would I stay there again yes just at $400 a night they need to fix some things for that rate with a view of the ally and hotel next door. For some recommendations. The Tides hotel on I believe 17th and Ocean. You must go there for drinks and appetizers EXCELLENT!!!!!!! - The Miami mojito my wife had with Vodka was the best I have ever tasted anywhere from NY - LA. Trust me you will not be disappointed. 3 amazing appetizers 1 mojito, 1 beer , 1 avian water . $65 Tax and tip included. And for entertainment right next door was an obvious gay mens outdoor bar called the Palace bar. It was pounding with great music and a interesting transgender sidewalk show. . On the diner side we at A Fish Called Avalon in the Avalon hotel. Excellent again but a bit dark i could not read my menu !! . Mango's a must see. If there girls dancing are not Ex strippers then they have that butty shaking dancing down pat. The Bar tender guys are to full of themselves. So we will be back now prepared to maximize out time.
reviews.title: My favorite South Beach hotel

reviews.text: I bought a weekend stay here for my sister as a treat and I stayed with her. Let me begin by saying that searching for a good hotel in south beach is a daunting task, especially if one is not familiar with the area. Even though I am a Miami local, South Beach was not too familiar to me and I was very unsure about what area and hotel would suit us/me best. I started my search on priceline and tried to bid on a 3.5 and 4 star hotel in the general area where I wanted to stay. However, everyone of my bids were rejected. I noticed that as the weekend was approaching, many of the "nicer" hotels were getting all booked. I was worried that I would not be able to treat my sister to a relaxing weekend on the beach. I probably reviewed every review on the top hotels in the area and was always surprised by the number of negative comments even for what were considered luxury hotels and ones that commanded $300+ per night (not including taxes, resort fee, parking) . Being a top-tier member at Hilton and Marriot, I decided to contact those hotels directly because that was what I was familiar with. I called Marriott South Beach and spoke with Alex Blanco. To make a long story shorter, he was able to book a room for us on very short notice for a reasonable price. It was more than I wanted to pay but less than what was advertised. At this point, I was thankful that I was able to secure a hotel room on south beach for the weekend.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...terrible service

reviews.text: I stayed at the Southbeach Marriott recently (Aug. 15-19th, 2011) for a solo ocean getaway. I had stayed at this hotel during prior visits (among others) to Southbeach and was aware of its location on the beach. Wanting a beach getaway with lots of ocean view, I knew this was the place to go. Located directly on the beach (separated only by dunes), on the southern end of SoBe. (there are ocean front hotels on the northern part of Sobe, which are very nice, but many of them don't have balconies). The ocean views from the balconies of the direct ocean view rooms are magnificent. I was unable to get a high floor room initially, but after staying in a lower floor room overnight and speaking with front desk staff the next day, they were able to move me into a higher floor room with direct ocean view (which I had reserved). The low floor direct ocean view rooms are good as well (view good), but the proximity to the outside terrace of the restaurant/loung/bar area exposes one to loud music from 6:00 a.m. until after midnight. So if you're trying to escape the constant thumping of the music, move upstairs. The rooms are not very large but certainly sufficient; beds are very comfortable (with no ugly bedspreads!). Room had everything one needs, including (for the ladies) a make-up mirror in the bathroom (even though I noticed my initial lower floor room did not have one). Rooms have a small refrigerator, so you can bring home (to the hotel room) some fruits and such and keep them cool; I prefer that over a mini-bar. Staff was very friendly. Restaurant was very accomodating to my low salt diet when asked. The Blue Deco Bar in the hotel serves one of the best Mojitos I've ever had (not cheap but definitely worth it). The pool is ocean front (and split into two pools of the same size). They are not very large, but the view of the ocean is very nice and the lounge chairs are lovely. Towels provided in the pool area. There are lounge chairs and towels available at the beach in front of the property, but at a charge. It's o.k. to bring your own beach towel, though and lay in the sand. Southe Pointe Park is a short walk away (to the South of the hotel) and is lovely; worth the walk over there. Also an automated bike rental station (DekoBike) is a block to the north and from there you can ride a bike and drop it off at many DekoBike stations in Southbeach. Nice convenience. It's lovely to bike around Southbeach, especially along the beachfront trails. Highly recommended activity. Overall I had a good experience at the Southbeach Marriott and would stay there again. Kudos to the Loss Prevention Department for promptly mailing me my favorite pair of white pants I forgot to pack when I left the hotel!! (faded into the sheets when I was packing, but maid was nice enough to turn them in).
reviews.title: Ocean Getaway

reviews.text: Stayed for just one night prior to a flight home from MIA. The hotel was great; smart lobby, nice restaurant, good breakfast (a touch expensive). The room was lovely, ocean view fantastic and balcony a real bonus. All staff we dealt with; bellboys , check-in , valet and waiting staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Loved it. Will stay again if we are back in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was excellent but there was a bit of a shortage of loungers so get up early and stay there as there is a notice saying that any loungers left vacant over an hour will be reallocated (seems pretty fair).
reviews.title: Great location, pool, beach access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neigbourhood is pretty quiet but has all the Ocean Drive has to offer with a 5 min stroll which is pretty much the best of both worlds.
reviews.title: nice oceanfront hotel on South Beach

reviews.text: We stay at this Marriott every year in November or December, when it is quiet in South Beach. South of 5th location is nice because it is quiet but up and coming neighborhood. The hotel is clean and fairly modern. Pool area is great for kids and adults alike. They have 2 pools (heated/not heated) and a hot tub overlooking beach. Ask for a room with ocean view balcony, see if you can get one on the north side overlooking park. Small workout room, spa services. The restaurant there is always empty so we don't typically eat there. But we have ordered lunch ($$$) but if you are hungry there is nothing like lounge chair service. They will serve you drinks on the beach! There are several great restaurants nearby, Nemo, Shoji Sushi, Prime Italian, Joe's Stone Crab (we've never been but it is popular), a gelato place too! There is a wine shop and deli a couple blocks south just below the Portofino. Also, a little Mexican grocery down a back street named La Playa that makes killer cuban sandwiches. This hotel is expensive but we cash in Marriott points so that makes it....cheap!
reviews.title: OK, but could easily be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent positioned hotel and we had a spacious clean room with a great view. Drinks at the bar are a little expensive, but it is Miami Beach. Bar meals were large , but very enjoyable. Tips (18%) added automatically to the bill which I prefer and makes it easy for us Brits. Found all the staff helpful. There is a very good restaurant across the road for dinner.
reviews.title: Great Position

reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel and we had a room that overlooked the Ocean. Room was clean as was the pool area. Now that I know how the area is set up I would feel comfortable trying a different hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: very clean hotel, great pool area. service is horrible, extremely expensive. everything in hotel is expensive. AMAZING location right on beach. a few blocks from night life, otherwise, in quieter area. a few blocks from convenient stores. rates can get very expensive. seems to be high in demand so they are not very accomodating. nice size rooms & very comfy beds. great balcony & easy check in
reviews.title: great hotel but expensive- RIGHT ON BEACH!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights With my wife after some meetings in Miami. We are in SoBe 4-5 times a year and never stay at the South end but Mercedes Benz Fashion week was on at the Raleigh and most of the hotels at the North end were booked for some of the nights we wanted to stay. Soooo...we tried the Marriott. Definitely not the Marriott hotels we have been in before. let me list a few things that caught our eye...all fixable with new management I would assume.
reviews.title: Will Not Be Back...

reviews.text: 1) Rooms OK..balcony dirty
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, little far from the action
